title: Strain Formula
text: Recall the formula for strain: ΔL $$=$$ $$\frac{F L_0}{A Y}$$, where ΔL is the change in length, F the applied force, Y is a factor, called the elastic modulus or Young’s modulus, that depends on the substance, A is the cross-sectional area, and $$L_0$$ is the original length.

title: Find the Elastic Modulus Y for Steel
text: Recall that the elastic modulus Y for nylon is $$210\times{10}^9$$.

title: Plug In and Solve for the Applied Force
text: Solve for F: $$0.008$$ $$=$$ $$1.35\frac{\frac{1}{210\times{10}^9} F}{\pi \left(0.5\times0.00085\right)^2}$$ (in Newtons, rounded to nearest whole number)?
